hackathon-description-text: Charlotte is teaming up with Kansas City, San Francisco, Chattanooga, and Burlington for a multi-city Gigabit Internet experience May 1-3. This is a

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Online News Editor at Broadband Communities magazine

hackathon-eligibility:
Developers, designers, dreamers & doers who want to advance their applications with gigabit networks
We will be contacting all the participants in advance so they can team up and start working prior to the event. We will also update the list of resources that will be available on the D-Day!
hackathon-rules: Rules will be updated later on.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3101 International Airport Drive #400, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How will this application benefit people and society?
How strong is the intellectual merit of the idea? How innovative is the use of next-gen technologies?
How compelling is the story for users?

hackathon-location-address: 3101 International Airport Drive #400, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA
hackathon-description-header: A 3-day hack event to ignite the gigabit experience.
